intro: Lobelia lavendulacea, commonly known as the lavender lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has heart-shaped, hairy leaves. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Lobelia lavendulacea is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
